results.title: Modern transport in Australia
results.creator_credit: Australian Instructional Films and Alex Ezard
results.brief_description: A brief history of transport in Australia. Various phases, either reconstructed or shown in action, are included: the first mailman, John Conway Burke, delivering by horse; wagons; Cobb & Co. coaches; trains and differences in gauges between States; road transport; aeroplanes in operation, including the Air Beef Lift, Flying Doctor and passenger services. Also includes historical footage of Melbourne and Sydney and emphasises Australia’s need for a vast transport system to develop its great areas.

results.title: Modern town rises from desert - Whyalla
results.brief_description: Whyalla in South Australia, showing aspects of its community life and describing its important industries. Blasting of iron ore, the production of iron and the extensive ship building industry.

results.title: Modern times
results.creator_credit: Mayfan, Film Australia, Graeme Isaac and Graham Chase
results.brief_description: An affectionate portrait of Port Pirie, the South Australian port and smelting town in which filmmaker, Graham Chase, grew up in the ‘50s and ‘60s. This is not merely a sentimental return to the long distant past. Rather, “Modern Times” presents an intimate insight into contemporary survival in an industrial town in decline, a story told with a mixture of empathy, scepticism and humour. Through the eyes of the “mates” who stayed behind in the town Graham Chase left, we receive a vivid picture of a small community facing an uncertain future as it struggles with new industries, the deadly legacy of lead pollution from the smelters and limited employment prospects.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Mayfan, Film Australia, Graeme Isaac and Graham Chase

results.title: Modern life: choices and conflicts
results.creator_credit: Stephen Bosustow Productions, Nick Bosustow and Charlie O. Hayward
results.brief_description: In four short situations this film examines a paradox of modern life; our increased knowledge about all phases of the universe except ourselves. In the first, a Wiggleman discouraged by one light switch which does not respond to him discovers a number of possible switches yet to be tried; in the second two figures choose togetherness in preference to separateness when their game on a teeter-totter doesn’t “work”; the third depicts two Wiggleman maintaining a difficult course over an obstructed road because of their optimism and the fourth portrays a figure who, undecided about all the possibilities open to him, grabs at them all only to become frustrated and confused.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Stephen Bosustow Productions, Nick Bosustow and Charlie O. Hayward

results.title: Modern France: the land and the people
results.brief_description: A brief geographical survey of modern France. Covers wheat farming in the North; flower gathering and orange growing on the Riviera; vineyards around Bordeaux; life at the port of Bordeaux; travel by barge on the Seine to Paris; the markets and shops of Paris; a steel-mill in Nancy.

results.title: Modern Europe: Norway
results.brief_description: Describes the geography of Norway from its mountains 8000 feet above sea level, to its lowland regions and fjords. Norways major industries are tourism, fishing, shipbuilding, agriculture, forestry and iron smelting. Also shows Norways landmarks, buildings of interest and ancient rock carvings. Suitable for secondary level.

results.title: Modern engines and energy conversion. - rev. ed.
results.brief_description: Explains the various types of engines which convert fuel to useful energy. Analyses the heat cycle of reciprocating turbine and rocket engines. Introduces the nuclear power engine, the ion engine and solar satellites. Suitable for middle secondary level.

results.title: Modern elementary mathematics: equations
results.brief_description: Animation and simple narration are used to explain the concept of equations. Examples are given to help children understand and correctly use equations to express the equality between numbers. Concludes with a number of true and false number sentences. Suitable for lower and middle primary levels.
